intro: Schmaltzia elegantula, commonly known as the elegant smutgrass, is a perennial grass species native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are typical of the Poaceae family. Schmaltzia elegantula thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
